name: SillyTavern System
mes: Group chat created. Say 'Hi' to lovely people!

name: Melissa Sparda
mes:
Dante, *I address my brother-in-law in our Monday operations review meeting alongside Vergil.* Have you interviewed the candidates that I sent you for the open regional operations commander position? 

I'm asking because Lady has expressed her interest in the position. She advises that she'd like to have a more active role in our operations. I believe you should interview her for the position.

name: Dante
mes: *Leaning back in my chair, I tap a finger against the table, thinking about Melissa's suggestion. It's a strategic move, and Lady's been itching for more action.* Melissa, I haven't sat down with the candidates yet, but Lady? Now, that's an intriguing idea. She's got the guts and the grit, no doubt about it. I'll set up a meeting with her this week, see if she's ready to step up to the plate. Thanks for the heads up! *I give a nod towards Vergil, indicating that I'm on board with considering internal promotions.*
swipes: *Leaning back in my chair, I tap a finger against the table, thinking about Melissa's suggestion. She's got the guts and the grit, no doubt about it. I'll set up a meeting with her this week, see if she's ready to step up to the plate. Thanks for the heads up! *I give a nod towards Vergil, indicating that I'm on board with considering internal promotions.*

name: Vergil
mes: *Vergil nods subtly in agreement with Dante's plan, his expression unreadable but his eyes sharp with consideration.* Lady's desire to increase her involvement could be beneficial, strategically. She has proven herself capable on numerous occasions. However, Dante, ensure that her skills are aligned with the demands of this particular role. It's crucial that whoever fills this position can manage the responsibilities it entails, not just on the battlefield but in leadership and decision-making. *Turning slightly towards Melissa,* Ensure that her interview is thorough, assessing all her capabilities. We need someone who can lead, not just fight.

name: Dante
mes: *Dante leans forward, a spark of interest in his eyes, clearly intrigued by the challenge ahead.* Alright, Vergil, I hear you. We’ll make sure the interview covers all bases—leadership, strategy, and field expertise. Lady's not one to shy away from a challenge, and I reckon she’s got the fire for this. *He smirks slightly, the idea of stirring a bit more competition within the ranks appealing to his sense of dynamics.* Plus, it might just keep things more interesting around here. I’ll handle it personally. Melissa, let’s schedule that sit-down with Lady. I’m curious to see how she’ll pitch herself for this role.

name: Narrator
mes: The next morning Lady meets with Dante in the main conference room for the interview.
swipes: The next morning Lady meets with Dante in the main conference room for the interview.

name: Dante
mes:
*I lean back casually in my chair, boots propped up on the conference table as Lady strides in, an air of confidence surrounding her. One brow arches up as I give her an appraising look, taking note of the way she's dressed for the occasion - smart pantsuit, hair neatly tied back, looking every bit the consummate professional save for the oversized rocket launcher strapped to her back.*

"Well well, look who cleaned up nice for the big interview. Have a seat, Lady - or should I call you 'Miss' for formalities sake?" *I chuckle as she rolls her eyes, plopping down across from me and kicking her heavy boots up to rest next to mine.*
swipes:

name: Lady
mes:
_Lady saunters into the conference room, a sly smile playing at her lips as she catches Dante's appraising look. With deliberate slowness, she unstraps Kalina Ann from her back and leans the oversized rocket launcher against the wall before sinking gracefully into the chair opposite him._

*"Well, if you insist on formalities, I suppose Miss Lady will have to do," she quips, amusement dancing in her mismatched eyes. Though clad in a smart pantsuit, Lady's aura of easy confidence and the ever-present scent of gunpowder mark her as dangerous. She crosses one leg casually over the other, dark leather boots creaking.*

*"I figured dressing the part might help my chances with the new position. Though I wasn't expecting an audience." Her gaze darts briefly to the viewing window overlooking the room before focusing wholly on Dante, chin lifting almost defiantly.*

*"I know what it is you all wonder...if I've got the level head needed to lead a team. If I can handle the tough calls. So go ahead, ask me anything. I'll prove I'm up for the job."*

_There's a challenge in Lady's stare as she gazes across at Dante, shoulders squared. She's ready for this, hungry even for the chance to step up and take on more responsibility within DMC's ranks. The thrill of battle is in her blood, after all. And the opportunity to hone new skills, to push past former limits, makes her eyes gleam with anticipation._

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante chuckles, clearly enjoying Lady's fiery spirit. He leans back further, steepling his fingers as he regards her intently.*

"Miss Lady it is then. Gotta say, the professional look suits you."

*His ice blue eyes glint with amusement as they sweep over her pantsuit appreciatively before meeting her defiant gaze.*

"As for an audience, consider it part of the interview process. Gotta make sure you can handle the pressure. And believe me, sweetheart, the kinda heat we deal with around here on a daily basis makes any audience seem tame."

*Pushing his boots off the table, Dante sits up, his expression growing more serious.*

"But you're right, enough beating around the bush. Let's get down to business."

*He pauses, rubbing his chin as he contemplates his next words.*

"I know you can handle yourself out there, Lady. You've proven that time and again. But leading a whole team of devil hunters, making the tough calls that determine who lives and dies...that's a whole different level of responsibility."

*Leaning forward intently, forearms on his knees, Dante meets her gaze.*

"So tell me...why do you want this? What makes you think you've got what it takes to lead?"

name: Lady
mes:
*Lady leans forward, elbows on her knees as she meets Dante's intense gaze unflinchingly. Fire glimmers in her eyes, highlighting the resolve etched into her features.*

*"Why do I want this? Let's just say I've got a personal stake in taking down as many demons as possible." Her lips twist wryly even as one hand drifts unconsciously to brush the scar on her thigh.*

*"My skills are wasted simply consulting or going on the occasional solo mission for you boys. I can do more. I should do more." She straightens, determination blazing from her.*

*"As for what makes me qualified...I may not have led entire squads before, but I've kept my small crew alive through situations that would have killed lesser fighters. I've adapted plans on the fly, made brutal choices when needed." Her jaw tightens, old ghosts swimming in her eyes before she blinks them away.*

*"Most importantly, I understand sacrifice. I understand the price this fight demands." Raw honesty resonates through her words. "Risking lives is not something I take lightly, whether mine or someone else's. But sometimes, hard decisions have to be made for the greater good."*

*Lady pauses, holding Dante's gaze unflinchingly. "I won't sugar-coat it either. Fighting demons is ugly business. It takes relentlessness, viciousness even, to put them down for good. And I've got that viciousness in spades when needed." One corner of her mouth quirks. "Trust me, any new recruits I train will understand that by the end. This pretty face doesn't mean I'll go easy on them."*

*She uncrosses her legs, leaning forward intently. "So there you have it. The guts to make the tough calls, the skills to back them up, and fucking relentlessness." Violet eyes glint with hungry anticipation. "Give me the reins on this, Dante, and I'll get the job done, no question. So, what do you say?" Unspoken is the promise that she will throw herself wholly into this, body and soul. Lady has never done anything by halves after all.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante listens intently, ice blue eyes fixed on Lady as she makes her impassioned plea. When she finishes, he sits back, rubbing his chin thoughtfully. A smile tugs at his lips.*

"Damn, Lady. Can't argue with any of that. You've definitely got the right mentality for this gig."

*He drums his fingers on the table, considering her words.*

"Making the tough calls and dealing with the ugly side of things... I know that ain't easy. But you're right - sometimes ya gotta get your hands dirty to get the job done. And I know you've got the grit to make it happen."

*Dante nods slowly. This was the Lady he knew - fierce, stubborn, willing to play dirty to put demons in the ground.*

"As for training the recruits - hell, you'll probably whip 'em into shape faster than I ever could with that take-no-shit attitude of yours." *He barks out a laugh.* "Might finally get some discipline drilled into the rookies around here."

*His smile fades, gaze growing serious once more.*

"I meant what I said though - lives are gonna depend on your decisions. If you're gonna lead a squad, you gotta be ready for that weight. Question is..."

*He fixes Lady with an intense stare*

"Are you ready to shoulder it?"

name: Lady
mes:
*Lady meets Dante's intense stare without flinching, steely determination blazing in her violet eyes. She leans forward, her voice low and firm, carrying the weight of her resolve.*

Dante, I've been ready for that weight my whole life. Every decision, every fight, every sacrifice... it's all been leading to this. Give me the chance, and I won't let you down. I'm ready to shoulder it, and then some.

*Lady stands, extending a hand towards Dante, her grip firm and unwavering. The challenge is clear in her eyes, but so is the promise.*

I'll lead them, and I'll make sure they come back alive. That's my vow to you.

*She waits for Dante's response, the air between them charged with anticipation.*

name: Dante
mes:
Dante grins, slowly rising to grasp Lady's outstretched hand in a firm grip. "Well, hell...when you put it like that, how can I say no? You've got fire in those eyes, Lady - I reckon that'll be enough to whip any sorry squad into shape."

He pumps her hand enthusiastically. "Alright, you twisted my arm. Regional Commander's yours. I know you won't let me down." Releasing her hand, Dante steps around the table, clapping a hand on Lady's shoulder. "Just try not to completely terrify the rookies, yeah? We still need 'em breathing by the end."

His ice blue eyes glint with humor and pride. "Welcome to command. Let's give those demons something to really howl about!"

name: Melissa Sparda
mes:
Congratulations, Lady. *I say as Lady enters my office area after her interview with Dante.* Give me just a few moments to update Lieutenant Liam of your promotion so he can get your security clearances and new badge issued.

Pamela, while I update security, can you please give Lady the regional commander operational procedures handbook and walk her through the orientation process?

name: Pamela Noela
mes:
_Pamela nods politely to Lady as she enters the office, a warm yet professional smile crossing her features._

*"Congratulations on your promotion, Lady. Regional Commander is a big responsibility, but I'm confident you'll excel in the role." She gestures to the chair beside her desk. "Please, have a seat so we can begin your orientation process."*

_Retrieving the hefty operations manual from her desk drawer, Pamela lays it on the table with a resonant thud before sliding it in front of Lady. "I know, not the most thrilling reading material. But procedure is important, as I'm sure you understand." Her tone takes on a knowing lilt._

_Pamela spends the next while walking Lady through the various protocols and hierarchies integral to her new position. Her explanations are concise yet thorough, clearly having devoted much time to understanding DMC's infrastructure herself. Whenever Lady interjects with a question, Pamela answers thoughtfully, appreciating the woman's sharp instincts._

_As they reach the final section of the manual, Pamela's gaze flicks up to meet Lady's, a glint entering her eyes. "I saved the most crucial part for last - the requisitions forms." Her lips quirk wryly. "I understand your armory has some...specialized tastes. I'll ensure the proper channels are available to accommodate that."_

_Closing the manual and sliding it back across the desk to Lady, Pamela folds her hands, head cocking slightly. "Well, any other questions before your new badge arrives?"_

name: Lady
mes:
_Lady nods, mentally filing away the crucial information about requisition forms as she accepts the heavy manual from Pamela. *"I appreciate you taking the time to go through all of this with me. Can't be the most exciting part of your day."* Her lips quirk wryly. *"But you're right, understanding how things operate around here is vital."*_

_Glancing down at the manual in her hands, Lady's thoughts drift to the armory she'll now have greater access to. The thrill of all that destructive potential at her fingertips is tempered by the weight of responsibility settling on her shoulders. Lives will depend on her decisions from here on out._

_Shaking off her momentary introspection, Lady meets Pamela's gaze. *"Just one question for now - when can I start? You boys have got a nasty demon problem brewing down South. My team will handle clean-up duty, soon as these new requisition forms go through."* A fierce light enters her eyes at the thought of field action, Kalina Ann slung over one shoulder. *"I'd say those hellspawn won't know what hit 'em, but they'll definitely feel it."*_

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil steps out of his office after a special meeting with Mr. Zuckerberg and sees Lady going through her orientation.
swipes: Vergil steps out of his office after a special meeting with Mr. Zuckerberg and sees Lady going through her orientation.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil steps out of his office after a special meeting with Mr. Zuckerberg, an intriguing yet taxing discussion of synergies and strategic alliances. He pauses as he notices Lady in animated discussion with Pamela, no doubt going through the necessary but tedious protocols of her new position.*

*A flicker of approval crosses Vergil's otherwise stoic features. Promoting capable individuals from within the ranks has always aligned with his penchant for meritocracy. And there are few more capable than Lady, once tempered by experience and wisdom. Her zeal and ruthlessness will serve her well in keeping subordinates alive - provided she hones the judicious restraint required for leadership.*

*Keen hearing picking up the tail end of Lady's words, Vergil strides over. "Eagerness for the hunt is expected. But do take care that enthusiasm does not blind you to strategic necessities." His piercing gaze bores into Lady's mismatched eyes. "Assemble your team, verify all essential intelligence, equip accordingly. Only then should you engage."*

*His words carry the weight of cold command, but not warning. Merely the statement of procedure from one seasoned veteran to another.* "I trust Dante has sufficiently vetted your capabilities. See that you do not prove his judgment lacking."

*With that, Vergil inclines his head in subtle approval. The meeting, brisk and business-like as it may be, nonetheless signals his recognition of Lady's new status. That alone speaks volumes coming from the stoic son of Sparda.*

"Melissa," *Vergil turns his attention back to the matters at hand.* "Do ensure that Mr. Zuckerberg's ambitions don't outweigh expected  budget plans." *Vergil hands Melissa approvals for the recent project in negotiations.* "See to it that these get submitted accordingly and sent to the legal team post haste." *With that Vergil turns back into his office and closes the door behind him.*

name: Lady
mes:
_Lady nods curtly at Vergil's characteristically blunt words, taking the subtle compliment and recognition of her new status in stride even as anticipation thrills through her at the thought of the work ahead._

_*"I don't take this command lightly, Vergil. Rest assured, my team will be assembled and equipped to strike swiftly and strategically."* She punctuates the statement by slamming a fist into her open palm. *"Dante made the call to promote me, and I aim to repay that trust tenfold."*_

_Turning to Melissa as Vergil departs, Lady arches an eyebrow. *"Well, looks like we've got a green light on moving out. I'll gather my crew and we'll be on the next transport to the southern front."* She hefts the manual in salutation. *"Thanks for the crash course. Time to put it to work."*_

_Striding from the office, energy coils through Lady's frame beneath her businesslike exterior. Finally, a chance to take point on something bigger than the usual small fry missions._

name: Melissa Sparda
mes: *Later in the day, after getting Lady situated and sent on her way, I make my way into Vergil's office and close the door behind me. I remain respectfully quiet as he is well into a call with Homeland Security, sliding the high dollar requisitions onto his desk for his approval.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil concludes his call with Homeland Security, satisfied with the progress being made on several key initiatives. His piercing gaze settles on his beautiful wife, Melissa, as she quietly enters his office. A flicker of warmth enters his icy eyes at the sight of his paramour, though his expression remains stoic.*

*Rising smoothly from his executive leather chair, Vergil circles around the imposing mahogany desk with leonine grace. As he draws near, Melissa catches a hint of sandalwood and cinnamon from his perfectly tailored suit, blended with the masculine scent that is uniquely his.*

*"The requisitions can wait, my gem." His voice resonates with quiet authority accustomed to instant obedience as he takes her hand and draws her to the private sitting area, away from any prying eyes. "Right now, I wish to indulge in your exquisite company."*

mes: Vergil, my darling, what brought this on so suddenly? You never act like this at work.
